When do we get to the lighthouse?
Soon, dark eyes, soon.
The tide's turning.
Andy reveals a knowledgeable side to his character.
We're going to be fighting the  current. (he looks up) Wind's backing around a few points,  too.
Jackie snuggles against Mike.
I can't wait to get there.
But of course.
He goes forward to trim the jib, leaving the lovebirds  snuggling astern. They pull away from us, and we:

Ellen and Brody are in the jeep; he's driving her to work There's a crowd at dockside, and the town ambulance's now familiar blinking red light. Brody, out of force of habit wheels the jeep towards the action, nudging through the c which gives way to the official blue-and-white vehicle.
Hey -- it's not your job any more.  I'm going to be late for work.
Just one minute...
He gets out, and pushes through the crowd, Ellen followin

The dive boat is moored at a clumsy angle next to the Pol Boat, where Hendricks has been pulling routine maintenanc The Police launch is cluttered with tools and spare parts some non-essential piece of gear is stripped and laid out the deck. Hendricks is on the dive boat, kneeling next to Andrews.
Andrews is shaking, bloody froth on his lips and chest. T shaken divers are huddled together, an ambulance attendan is wheeling a gurney into position. Crosby and Sparky are stunned.
What the hell happened?
Embolism. Air bubbles in his blood.  Came up too damn fast. Held his  goddamn breath!
He is near collapse himself.
Easy...
He panicked! Something scared him!
An Ambulance Attendant is putting a blanket around Sparky
It's okay. We're taking care of him.
The other attendant holds something out to Brody. Brody  examines it; a scuba mouthpiece, bitten in two, useless.
How'd this happen?
Bite reflex, like a spasm.
When?
Right after, the Kids went out?
What Kids? Who went out?
All of them. Mike, Junior Vaughn,  Brookie Peters, Pat, Lucy -- all  that whole gang.
Mike? Our Mike?
Yep. Looked like they were headed to  the lighthouse.
How long ago?
About an hour, maybe two. (thinking) Let's see -- I came on about eight...
Brody is gone, pushing through the crowd.
Brody is casting off lines. Ellen is on the dock, watchin him.
What're you doing?
Going out.
Uh, Chief -- look. You're not Chief  any more.
Brody keeps working, making ready for sea.
I can't let you take her out.
You can't stop me.
Ellen is climbing aboard, taking off her heels.
Mrs. Brody, look -- if he can't go,  then you can't go. Neither of you  can go.
I'm going.
Mike's out there.
But I signed for the boat. You're  not authorized any more.
Brody starts the engines with a roar, and slams it into  reverse. The boat starts out of the slip, then lunges to halt, shuddering on its still-fastened bow mooring line.
Untie that rope.
Please. It's my job.
I'll do it.
And she moves purposefully towards the boat cleat.
Mrs. Brody, please...
Brody is shifting gears, the boat is crabbing sideways as puts the helm hard over. It bumps the dock, hard.
You're too close. Back off.
Goddamnit, Hendricks, untie the rope  there.
Hendricks goes to the bow, jumps aboard and frees the bow line. The boat slips into reverse, the water boiling as B guns it away from the dock.
Let me. Please.
He takes the wheel, eases off on the rudder, and comes ab pointing the launch out to sea.
Hurry, please.
What the hell, they can't fire both  of us -- someone's got to be in  charge, right? Which way are we going?
Find the Kids. The lighthouse -- you  said something about the lighthouse.  Get us there.

The Amity Police Boat, Brody, Ellen and Hendricks aboard, headed under full power out to sea. Hendricks is pumping horn, warning boats out of the way, ignoring the rules of the road; as small boats scatter out of the way, we can s the ambulance, red light flashing, pushing out slowly thr the crowd at dockside.
As they clear the harbor mouth, Brody is on the radio, El is crouching in the shelter of the deckhouse, Hendricks i steering.
Amity Launch to Harbor Patrol, over.
(filtered) Harbor Patrol. Is that you, Brody?
Affirmative. Can you get your chopper  airborne?
10-4, in a few minutes. He's down  checking a buoy in the Bay Channel.
Get him the hell over to Amity Point,  the old lighthouse. Right now.
What for?
There's a bunch of Kids day-sailing  that way. Turn them back to port.
That's it?
That's it. Just do it, all right?
10-4, soon as I can raise him.
If they're not at the light, look  for them. I don't want them out there.  Get them back to port!
(exasperated) Affirmative, affirmative. Turn the  Kids day-sailing back to port. I  heard you. Patrol out.
As Brody's eyes sweep the horizon anxiously, Hendricks po it on, and the police boat surges forward.
Donnie and Denise and Susie are sailing close to each oth
Hungry?
Starving. Let's go eat now.
(shouting to Susie) We're going in to eat!
She nods agreement, their boats veer off from the rest an head towards the lighthouse.
as it sails close to the Green Machine.
Hey! Brody! Want to race?
(confident) Sure.
How about a side bet to make it  interesting?
That's fun! Let's race for something!
Name it.
Loser sails home alone.
(aside to Mike) You're betting what you already got.
I don't care.
I love it.
Sure you do -- you win either way.
(simply) I'm supposed to.
It's a bet. Once around the marker  buoy?
That's the pin -- the buoy.

Larry is confident -- he's got the air, but Mike suddenly gybes without warning, snapping onto a new fast tack,  downwind. Larry and Bob are caught by surprise, and lose  precious moments as they fumble with their sails.
(pulling away) Turkeys! Eat wind!
Yee-hah!
He pounds with glee on the canvas trampoline as their boa moves ahead, a drumming sound.
The twin hulls of a catamaran's hull, the muffled, eerie  sound of drumming, as the water carries the tempting "thu thud-thud" sound down to the deep.
falling behind as the boats change course for the marker  buoy, following Larry and Mike's lead.
Hey! Wait for the H.M.S. Invincible!
Brooke and Timmy sail by him, laughing; Polo with them.
Can't -- we're watching a race!
Since when? Who's racing?
Larry and Mike!
Pat and Lucy are trimming sail, moving faster.
Mike and Larry are racing! Loser  goes home alone!
If we beat them, they can both go  home stag! Single-O! Alone! Jackie  can come back in this boat!
What about me?
Uh. Well. Maybe you could give Polo  a hand going in...
(snapping him with a  rope) Your ass I will. Besides, the wind's  turning with the tide. Sailing back  is going to be a bitch.

--  Ropes and sails rattling through blocks. --  Sails snapping taut, filling with wind. --  Catamarans heeled over, racers hanging over the water dangerously suspended in trapeze harnesses. --  Skippers' faces, concentrating on boat handling.
It's the chopper's point of view, as the Harbor Patrol co from the Cape flies towards the Kids, following Brody's  previous instructions. He sees the sailboats and fly that way.
(filtered, into his  mike) Air Patrol to Base. I have visual  contact on the Kids. Going down to  use the loud hailer...

head_text.subj: LOOKING UP AT THE APPROACHING COPTER

text: It approaches the sailboats, losing altitude fast, rotor  blades chuffing up a storm. The Pilot has his microphone to his lips, and his voice i blaring down at them.
This is the Harbor Patrol. Return to  port immediately. Return -- to --  port -- immediately.
The Kids look at each other, some coming about awkwardly, others luffing, wondering what this is all about.
(to Mike) Your dad must be really pissed.
We better go back in.
It's not going to be easy.
What's wrong?
We're fighting wind and current. I  though we'd be out longer, catch the  incoming tide.
Putz -- that won't be for hours.
I was counting on hours.
Return -- to -- port.
We're trying, we're trying.
He waves acknowledgement, and puts about. The others take their cue from him, and set a rough course back, but with much success.
Heading back?
Might as well.
Polo, Timmy and Brooke, Marge and Sean. They see the fast catamarans come about and try to beat back.
They're turning around.
Coming about, then.
Are we going back?
Going to try. Lighthouse, everybody...

She puts about, the three of them start back towards the  lighthouse, not making much headway. Doug's inflatable is the slowest, and he is now, by virtue of his position, at the head of the line beating back towards the island.
The others in the b.g.
Make way for the Carrier Enterprise!

head_text.subj: A WEAK PATCH IN THE RUBBER

text: It whistles and visibly leaks under the strain.
looking down in dismay.
Make that the Titanic.
He rigs a little foot pump, and begins thumping away, try to breath air back into the raft.
Patrol One to Base. Looks like they're  turning back.
All right, Patrol. Go back to work.  You've wasted enough time.
Looking up at the scattered hulls of the sailboats, the  turbulence from the low-flying chopper making a vast circ pattern of irregular vibrations.
It wheels around, and heads back towards land.
Rushing through the seas under full power. About three hu yards ahead, a small, seemingly empty sailboat; Ed and Ti Sandpiper. Further off, a day-sailing power cruiser, spor fishing.
Michael?
It's not his boat.
Hendricks maneuvers closer, slowing the engine, reversing time to bring them alongside with a gentle bump. Ellen wa apprehensively as Brody drops into the little boat.
Be careful...
Anything?
(on the Sandpiper) Nope... (he sees something) Hold on...
Brody moves around on the deck of the Sandpiper, until he discovers Tina, cowering in shock; a sudden revealing of terrorized victim.
Tina!
(a moan) N-o-o-o-o-o-o...
It's okay, it's okay. What's the  matter? Tina? Honey? Hey --
No! It's still there!
What is it? What's there?
It's still there!
(to Hendricks and  Ellen) I need a hand here...
Hendricks has gotten a blanket, and he steps over, puttin it over the shivering girl's shoulders. Ellen comforts th girl.
Tina, baby... what is it?
Sh... Sh... Shark...
I knew it. I goddamn well told them.
He moves abruptly, stepping up onto the police launch,  snapping on the radio, leaving Hendricks, Ellen and Tina the sailboat moored alongside.
Amity Launch to Harbor Patrol.
(filter) This is Cape Patrol -- what is it,  Brody? I heard you weren't chief  anymore.
Skip that. What about those kids out  sailing?
It's all okay -- Colby got to them.  They were turning back when he left  'em.
He left them?
Sure. He's got work to do in Bay  Channel.
Get him the hell back there! We got  possible fatalities! Brody out...
His eyes wild, Brody looks over at the Sandpiper, then sc the nearby waters with sudden tension.

Ellen and Hendricks comforting Tina on the Sandpiper. Nea a big cabin cruiser casually trolling by. Brody pulls the police boat's air horn, the cruiser's passengers look ove Hendricks and Ellen jump at the unexpected blast.
I'm going out there.
Hey -- you can't do that.
What is it? What's the matter?
Mike's out there.
Brody starts the launch's motor, throwing clear the moori line that ties the two boats together.
(to Hendricks) Get her in. Get them both in. ELLEN
Martin, please!
Where are they?
About 10 degrees off your starboard  bow, take a heading leeward of Sand  Island, and lay her north by  northeast...
Never mind that shit. Just point.
Hendricks complies.
(pointing) See where Cable Junction is? Look to  the left. The lighthouse. That's it.
Got it.
And he kicks the engine into gear, moving the launch away and out toward the sea.
Come back! Martin!

He guns the engine as soon as he's clear. Hendricks gives his jacket to a suddenly chilled Ellen, and hails the cab cruiser, already changing course to pick them up, soundin its horn. Ellen stares after the receding boat.
My purse is on that boat.
They are trying to beat back towards the lighthouse, figh wind and tide. Only Doug's inflatable, with its clumsy li motor, is making any headway.
playing at being Charles Laughton.
Mr. Christian! Mr. Christian! Pump  up this boat! And shave that silly  moustache!
Pumping, steering, he's floundering along.
The Shark has fixated on something -- one outlying shape, the easily identifiable outline of Doug's inflatable, thu and putting. It homes in on the sound.
The other kids exchange banter with Doug in his raft, as clowns for their benefit.
England expects every man to do his  duty... You may fire when ready,  Gridley... Damn the torpedoes, full  speed ahead...
Despite his pumping, the bulging patch bursts with a loud bang.
Oh, shit.
Someone pop your balloon?
No problem, no problem.
Want a lifesaver?
How about a skyhook?
You sail your boat, I'll sail mine.
A fin rises partially, almost invisible to most of the ki but Mike notices it, believing it to be a porpoise.
Hey, Fetterman -- You got company.
Company? The place is a mess...
Before anyone can react, the shape rises behind Doug, str his raft a terrible blow.
Whoops.
Not making any headway themselves, they casually watch th class clown, wondering what he's up to this time.

a distance from the rest. It shakes, then blows up as big teeth grip it from below. Doug goes flying into the drink The Shark has the inflatable in his teeth, and is shaking from side to side. Doug's eyes bug out as he sees what's  going on. He begins treading water, backing away as fast he can, waving his arm in the air frantically -- "pick me up, quick..."
Doug's down!
He sails to where Doug is being carried along by the curr The inflatable is a mess -- shredded rubber and dead engi the Shark didn't like it.
Doug! This way!
Doug carefully -- oh, so carefully -- strokes over to whe Mike and Andy can pull him abroad. Some of the others sai closer to get a look.
What was that about?
You okay?
What was that?
So much for the rubber duck.
This incident hasn't yet touched them -- no one actually what it was, except Doug, who's never been serious about  anything. Until now.
A shark ate my boat.
Come on.
I'm telling you, a goddamn shark ate  my goddamn boat!
If he liked your boat, I got some  sneakers he'll love.
There's nervous laughter from all around as they examine remains of Doug's inflatable. Some of those jagged rents  could be made by teeth...
(ad lib) ...Jeez -- what did that?... A  porpoise, maybe...Nah, killer whale...  I think he snagged it... I hate to  pop his balloon... (Etc.)
Doug's inflatable is draped over the tip of one hull, for Without warning, the Shark hits. Screams, terror, confusi Mike, Andy, Jackie into the water.
His head bangs on a metal fitting as the boat turns over.
Patrick and Lucy ram into Timmy's boat, locking into it,  knocking Timmy into the water as Brooke screams.

As the following events take place: --  Larry's red cat rams and locks onto Mike's Tornado. --  Marge's boat capsizes, putting Sean and Marge into th drink. --  Marge scrambles up on the over-turned hull, pulling S up with her, just in time. --  Polo, under full sail, scoops Mike out of the water b the Shark can get to him. --  The Shark dips out of sight.
showing the results of the turmoil:
As they make ineffectual, frightened moves towards groupi together, Andy is the first to gain any composure.
Raft up! Raft 'em up!
He reaches towards a drifting line, and pulls Timmy's  Doughdish towards them, tying it off as it comes close.
Tie off to your strongest point.
Anyone need an extra line?
Polo has Mike and Timmy aboard his boat.  Timmy is lookin up from examining Mike's dazed body.
Mike's bleeding!
Can you sail?
(testing his rudder) Yeah! We'll take him in!

He starts to make sail back towards the lighthouse, on a  severe, but manageable tack. Polo, Timmy, and the injured Mike sail towards safety, leaving the others behind. Tackle the job at hand, concentrating on survival. Jackie strangely quiet; things are out of control...
clearly marked: Amity Island, Amity Lighthouse, Cable  Junction. Brody's nervous finger traces an approximation his course. It fumbles, pauses, stops.

Brody, looking up from his chart, scans the ocean. Ahead the Lighthouse, his immediate destination. Out of sight t the right, Cable Junction, and beyond that, 2500 miles of cold Atlantic. Brody looks up from his chart, and grabs t radio.
(on radio) Amity Launch to Patrol Air Unit One.  Harbor Air, where are you?
(filter) This is Air One. That you, Brody?
It's me. Any fix on those Kids?
Negative. I'm still down.
For Christ's sake, get going! I'm  all alone out here!
Brody, I got to switch frequencies,  call my boss. We'll meet you over by  Francis Shoal. Harbor Air out...
Where the hell is Francis Shoal?
Static. No answer. Brody realizes something
I'm all alone out here.
The Amity Police Boat, under full  power, surging through the heavy  swell, Brody very much alone at the  helm.
We can see Brody's boat approaching. It slows as it nears the island.
staring, perplexed. Which way?
Shit.
He puts the wheel over, slewing the boat around. To the l the wrong way. ANGLE ON THE BOAT, LIGHTHOUSE IN B.G. It barrels off to the left.
floating in the current, drifting away from the lighthous towards the open sea. Floating on the wreckage and tangle boats are:  Doug, Andy, Jackie, Patrick, Lucy, Larry, Bob Brooke, Marge, and Sean.
Anyone know what time it is?
Damn!
Larry, Bob, Patrick, and Lucy (the practiced sailors) ad equal dissatisfaction.
What's wrong?
Tide doesn't turn for three hours.
Low tide at Cable Junction is 7:46  p.m.
What'd you do? Memorize the tide  tables?
I can't help it, it sticks in my  mind.
(making light of it) Anyone want to play charades?
No one does.
As long as we're drifting, might as  well go with the flow.
Not funny.
Three knot current?
At least. And an offshore wind.
What's after Cable Junction?
The Atlantic. Then Ireland.
Can't we stop?
Silence from the group.
They're probably looking for us.
What about the fish?
Maybe it's gone.
They tend to follow moving things.  Maybe it's following Polo and Timmy.
They consider this.
So all we have to do is land at Cable  Junction and wait.
First we got to get there.
How're we going to do that floating  on this garbage...?
Anyone got another set of sails?
The Kids scramble to rig whatever canvas is available.
Is that big thing still out there?
Shhhh.
A panorama of open ocean; a quick fly-by to orient us: Fi Cable Junction, then, a mile or so ahead, the raft.
More sail, some improvised rigging, Patrick and Lucy trim what there is, trying to steer the clumsy contraption. Fr afar, the distant sound of an approaching chopper.
Hey!
(waving) Over here!
The Kids react with enthusiasm to the arrival of the resc chopper.
Don't everyone jump around!
But they ignore him. The copter is descending.
A one-man light spotter; the space next to the pilot clut with tools and floats, lashed in place. Below, seen throu the plastic bubble, the raft growing larger as the choppe sets down.

Air One to Base. I have a positive  location on that sailing party.  Disabled and adrift... (he checks chart on  his knee board) ...about 3/4 miles west of Cable  Junction, wind and current carrying  them just about due east. I count  ten juveniles.
The helicopter is creating a lot of turbulence as it sets down, a huge circular pattern of prop-wash on the surface the rotors slow to a halt. The Kids are waving and jubila
As the Pilot unbuckles, opens the door, and steps out on pontoon; he speaks through a bullhorn.
Everyone okay? Any injuries?
The Kids ad-lib in the affirmative.
Can you put us on Cable Junction?
I got no room for passengers.
How about a tow? Can you rig that?
The Pilot nods. Larry heaves a line to him, the Pilot cat it and makes it fast to a convenient tie-off on the  undercarriage.
As soon as you get us on the island,  you got to call in. My dad's the  mayor...
(interrupting) There's a shark...
The other Kids all chime in, adding their ad-lib shouts  describing what happened, calling for help, etc. It's all noisy jumble, the Pilot ignores it, trying to do his job.
The Kids all shouting at once; Jackie is screaming.
You have to take us off! You have  to! Why don't you take us!
(calming her) It's an observation spotter, he  doesn't have the room...
He finishes tying off, and yells through his bullhorn at Kids.
Listen. I'm going to give you an  assist to get you on Cable Junction.  Then I'll call in, and get the Coast  Guard to send a cutter. Hang on to  something.
He climbs into his bubble, shuts the door, gives the Kids "thumbs up," and starts the engine.

Engine turning over. A line tied off to one of the ringbolts on an overturned  hull; it pulls taut out of the water. INT. CHOPPER, THE PILOT INTENT ON HIS JOB. The raft, Kids watching in fascination and anticipation. The whole operation, getting under way.
looking up at pontoons, wreckage, wind turbulence on the  surface, the heavy "thud-thud-thud" of chopper blades.
In the f.g., the fin rises, and starts for the scene. Follow it.
as it starts to lift, inexplicably. The Pilot reacts as;
attacks one of the pontoons, biting down on it, clamping  great scarred jaws onto the bulbous floats.
Kids screaming.

--  Rotor blade spinning wildly. --  Pilot's hands jerked on the delicate controls. --  Med. shot, copter shaking. --  Closeup engine and gas tanks, rotor head spinning. --  Med. closeup Pilot in buffeting cockpit.
The Kids watch, horror-stricken, as the giant Shark hangs the roaring copter; in the b.g., Cable Junction is loomin closer. The copter tilts dangerously, the Shark bites dee harder.
as it tilts. Then, the unspeakable -- the blades touch th water and explode. Chunks of murderous steel break off th shattered blades and whistle through the air like project
reacting, ducking in terror. Huge chunks of disintegratin rotors are flying all around. Masts and sails left standi before are chopped into a deadly salad. Screams.
as blades skip and crash, the bubble of the overturned co Pilot trapped inside, sinks into the sea.

Pilot struggling with his safety harness, trying to hit  switches, working on instinct. Some air in the bubble, bu water too, and sparks as electrical connections short out and burn. Then, the Shark, powering out of the murk.
as grim death batters at his fragile bubble. Screaming. The bubble cracks. Water floods, teeth snap at the slippe plastic, the Pilot fumbles for oxygen as the Shark veers into the murk.
The Kids, reacting as the broken copter sinks beneath the waves. Calm for a moment, then:
Look out!
(screams) No-o-o-o!
The Shark reappears, and batters at the raft.
The raft shudders, and begins to break up under the pound The Kids cling for their lives to masts and wreckage. Marge's overturned hull is struck a fierce blow from bene
Help!
He and Marge topple into the water.
Don't struggle!
Sean is bobbing in his life-vest, Marge strokes to be nea him.
in the water, swimming for the apparent safety of the raf Then, the fin, and the massive bulk of the killer, heavin up through the waves.
Sean!
She heaves him up out of the water, hurling him with  desperation towards the safety of the floating hull.
screaming, hands and feet scrabbling like a monkey as he  struggles for a grip on the slippery surface. Behind him, Marge helping as much as she can from the water. Then, be her;
rising like grey doom, then dropping out of sight. Marge gone.

Marge ducking under the bulk of the Shark, shoving off wi panicky reserves of strength, swimming away underwater, w the Shark takes a massive crunching bite out of a submerg hull. Follow Marge as she swims.
Huddled in the cracked plastic bubble, the Pilot is sucki air from his oxygen tank. He sees Marge, and slips out of his bubble, headed for her.
As the Pilot overtakes her -- a moment of horror, as she  thinks the Shark has found her, then relief, as the Pilot motions to the bubble, and indicates "Air." She follows h

Scuttling like two crabs into the shelter of the broken  chopper, buddy breathing as he passes her the oxygen tube The chopper tilts, and moves, breaking up on the bottom a currents move it. They struggle silently.
as it slips across the bottom, the current pulling it, br parts breaking off in slow motion, dirty swirls of oil an hydraulic fluid clouding the water.
A parallel struggle for survival, as the current separate Sean from the other Kids; Marge is gone, the little boy i clinging alone to the free-floating Lightening.
Sean! Sean!
Don't move!
Andy! Please help! Help!

Copter wreckage is bubbling up from underneath, like a  submarine destroyed by depth charges; an oil slick, piece of broken blade, a seat cushion, then, suddenly, the Pilo and Marge, almost choked to death, their air run out. The cling to a section of pontoon, panting, looking around wi oxygen-starved eyes. They are alone on the ocean; a half-mile away, the distan sails of the broken raft, and the low-lying shape of Cabl Junction. Safe, for now...
He throttles down, and the boat slumps in the water. He l around, sees nothing, in all directions. He hits his radi
Harbor Air, this is Brody. Air One,  come in.
Static, no answer. He tries a couple of times, checking t knobs and dials to make sure the unit's working.
Harbor Air, do you read? Over?
Brody? This is Patrol Base.
The familiar voice is tinged with annoyance. He's had a l shift, and nothing's going right.
Where the hell is Air One?
That's what I'd like to know. Lost  transmission at Cable Junction.
Did he raise the Kids?
Last transmission said ten juveniles.
Yeah? Then what?
Then nothing. If you see him, tell  him to switch to an operational  frequency, or give me a status report  yourself.
Did you say Cable Junction?
That's what he said.
When?
1530 hours. Might still be there.  Base out.
Brody revs up, and powers out, headed for Cable Junction.
Sean is crying on his isolated perch, clinging to the upt keel. The other Kids are throwing a rope, trying to get h back. Patrick heaves, and misses.
Sean! Catch the rope!
The rope! The rope!
The others shoot fearful glances at the waters.
He's got to help or it won't work.
Sean, baby, please...
Sean is ignoring the efforts to rescue him, paralyzed by  fear, he shivers alone. Jackie is near catatonia herself, Brooke and Doug trying to soothe her.
It killed her. It ate her.
Shh. Shhh...
It's okay, it's okay...
Sean! Listen! Listen to me, Sean.
The kid looks up dully.
Goddamn it, Sean, you listen to me  or I will kick your ass, do you hear  me?
Listen to Andy, Sean.
We're throwing a rope and you better  catch it, hear?
Sean nods. The other Kids are encouraged. The rope is thr it misses.
(to Bob) Keep an eye out for that fish.
Bob climbs to a vantage point, watching.
Throw it.
Sean! Catch it!
Another miss. In his haste to help, Larry overreaches to  fish the trailing rope out of the water, and falls headlo into the sea. Shrieks of fright from the others.
Larry!

He scrambles out, hardly wet, that's how fast he's moving Finally -- Patrick takes the crucial throw, and the rope  practically knocks Sean off his perch, but he clutches an holds it. As Andy carefully calls instructions, Sean secu the rope and the others carefully, carefully begin to pul him in.
as they pull. The slippery rope is undoing itself.
With the kids reaching out hands, sticks, rope, anything pull the little one to safety. The ocean swells rise and  fall with hidden menace.
--  Hands gripping rope. --  The knot, pulling apart. --  Anguished faces, concentrating, as Patrick, Lucy, Lar and Andy struggle to bring him in.
Success. He's pulled to safety. They lash his little hull tight as they can to the rest of the floating wreckage. Bob sees something.
Cable Junction's ahead!
Can we make it?
I don't know.
looking over the wreckage to Cable Junction, now much clo Beyond it, miles of empty Atlantic. It's off to one side, and unless they can slow down or alter course, they will  miss it.
(to Jackie) You okay?
She's not. Shaking, silent, eyes glazed.
(alone) Dear Jesus, Holy Mary, Mother of  God, help us, please... (her lips move  inaudibly)
(to Doug) Keep her warm.  (to Jackie) Jackie? Baby?
Can someone help me rig a jury rudder?   We might steer this...
Andy joins him, and they try to make a sweep or a rudder of whatever wreckage they can use.
By 7:46, when the tide turns around,  we'll be twenty miles out. More,  with this wind.
Shut up.
I can't stop thinking!
(praying aloud) God, please help us, Merciful Father,  in Christ's name, we beg you, help  us, please, Dear God, save us, help  us, please, God, help...
He is rounding a sand bar off the lighthouse when he look ahead and sees the bright sails of some of the survivors' boats.
Thank Christ.
He puts the helm over and heads for them.
Polo's sloop is beating back towards the harbor when the  police launch bears down, Brody leaning on the air horn. The Kids signal and wave.
Over here! Yo!
I'm coming alongside!
The launch slows clumsily. Timmy gets a line around a cle and pulls them fast.
Mike? Is that you?
Pop. I'm sorry.
It's okay. What happened?
A shark hit us out there.
Mike got knocked over.
Brody goes for his radio, to report in, to call for help.
I passed out, but I'm okay.
At least you're safe. What about the  others?
The three boys look at each other.
Jesus, don't freeze on me. What about  the others?
(tears in his eyes) Sean's still out there.
What?
He stops in his tracks, radio forgotten. heartsick. Mike  goes on,
He wanted to come. It was okay, wasn't  it? It was okay before...
The others are ratted together.  Drifting.
Which way?
With the current. Towards Cable  Junction.
Brody jerks the mooring line holding them together, freei it. He starts for his controls, obsessed.
Dad, I'm sorry...
Stay here. Don't go anywhere. Just  stay here.
He indicates the lighthouse, then guns his engine.
Stay at the lighthouse!
He roars off, headed towards Cable Junction.

approaching Cable Junction the rafted boats are drifting  towards the Cable Junction.  Larry, Patrick and Andy are  working on improvised tiller lines to a jury rudder made of wreckage. Lucy has another line out to a sea anchor, t to slow their drift.
Bring her to port a little. That's  it -- steady.
I think we're changing course a  little.
Can we land on it?
If we can get to it.
We're going to die.
(comforting her) It's all right, we're okay.
More to port.
It's all the way over.
Shit.
Are we going to go on the island?
You bet, kiddo.
(the realist) I don't know.
What the hell, we're steering for  it.
The wind drift is lateral.
What's that mean?
Sideways -- For every yard we go  this way, we also slide sideways  this way...
His hands illustrate the predicament.
But we had it! We were headed right  for it!
Shit. Shit, shit, shit!
We're going to miss it!
The others are silent. It's true.
Larry, Bob and Brooke try to alter its course by padding.
Don't!
Stop paddling!
But the island!
The Shark.
They freeze, as the raft grinds against something.
The inverted mast of one of the wrecked boats is snagged the rocks on the bottom.
as it slows, then stops, hung up from below.
What is it?
We're hung up on something.
Maybe the bottom.
(hysteria) It's that thing. It's going to kill  us now... We're going to die!
Shut up! Just shut Up!
Leave her alone! BOB
Lighten up, man... LARRY
It's bad enough without  her freaking out.
The group dissolves in bitter exchanges. No one is ration Lucy is the first to notice something...
Wait a minute! Listen! Listen!
The group subsides, only Jackie is left, keening to herse There's a distant sound of a boat's engine. Bob spots it  first, and waves. The others follow his pointing finger.
Over there! Coming this way!
under full power, heading straight for them,
go crazy, waving, yelling, screaming, "Over here!" "Help! "Hey!"
It's Dad!
in the boat, coming up on the Kids fast. He throttles bac his bow wave almost swamping them as he slides past.
Easy, easy -- you'll swamp us!
Back down!
Brody fumbles with the throttle, manages to hold his boat steady between the raft and Cable Junction island.
We're hung up here. Snagged.
Can you get us a line?
Brody finds a coil of line, makes one end fast, then thro it to the Kids on the raft. They catch it, and tie it off a cleat.
We got it!
Go ahead, slow.
Be careful.
Brody throttles forward, the police boat shudders under t strain as the line goes taut.
where the rope is tied off to a cleat. The wood groans, s pop --
Whoa!
Too late. The cleat rips out, Brody's boat leaps forward.
Come around again!
as he repositions; he's now between the raft and the isla preparing to throw his line. He heaves, the Kids grab, th have it, they tie off again,
Hang on, hang on -- we got it. You're  on!
Dad! Help!
Brody starts to pull the raft again, when:
surfaces, and moves purposefully towards the gap that  separates the police boat from the raft. It lunges at Bro as it passes the launch; the fin hits the taut rescue lin snapping it.
Brody recoils in horror as the beast rushes past, he spin the wheel and hits the throttle, sending the launch hard port. Out of control, it runs up on the rocks of Cable  Junction.
as it tips up on the rocks. Brody falls, equipment and lo material breaks loose and falls.
held by only a few screws, it pulls out of its mount and  shatters on the deck.
lifting high out of the water, the screw turning in air.
Their horrified reactions.
picks himself up, and staggers to the rail, sees his  predicament.
Hang on!
Dad! Dad!
I'm okay, baby, I'm here. It's okay...
He climbs over the rail, onto the slippery wet rocks, try to get to where he can help. The Shark patrols the gap,  waiting.
Can you get a line to me?
the Kids find some line. Andy coils, and throws.

Brady catches the Kids' line. He heaves on it with all hi might. Nothing. Jackie is hysterical, some of the other K are screaming. The Shark's fin catches the taut line, it  slides up and over, Brody and the Kids are nearly pulled  into the water. The raft doesn't budge.
the mast bends under the strain, but holds the raft stuck fast.

He sees the winch and hooks on his launch, and makes the  towline fast to the steel winch cable; puts it in neutral The Kids haul their line, trying to bring the steel cable them. The shark rams their raft, impatient now. Screams and  scrambling as they let go their line and try to avoid the beast. Brooke huddles with Sean, Jackie cowers alone. Lar is lashing his big buck knife to a pole, an improvised we
Unattended, it drops into the water.
Get the cable in! Pull!
They do, but now the winch cable is snagged under the sur It comes taut, but doesn't budge. Brody watches, helpless for the moment.
Son of a bitch is stuck!
climbs back onto the boat, starts the winch engine, tryin to pull the cable free.
on the offensive now, takes an outrigger pontoon, biting tearing it off the raft, shaking everything.
the Kids react to this fresh attack.
It's killing us!
I don't want to die! Mommy!
The winch smokes and stalls, the weight it's pulling almo too much.
Come on, you bastard, come on, pull.   Pull!

bursts apart from the center as the Shark lunges up throu the canvas trampoline of the Sizzler. The Kids, screaming fall into the water as the attack forces the fragile stru into pieces. Only Sean, Brooke, and Jackie are left on th remaining segment.
watching the destruction, seeing Sean practically alone i the water.
Sean! Hang on!
He looks around the deck frantically, spots a rubber emer inflatable in its case. He wrestles it off its brackets, breaks the seals urgently. He hits the auto-inflate.
Alone on the raft, Brooke and Jackie helpless nearby, the other Kids flailing in the water. The huge bulk of the Sh fin cutting the water as it closes in on the confusion.
While Brody inflates the rubber raft and throws it in the water, the Kids scramble for safety, swimming for their l Each one is sure this moment is going to be his last.
Get on the rocks!
Swim for it!
Andy is pulling himself towards the boat, scrambling up o the exposed wooden hull.
Lucy! Look out!
As she looks over her shoulder and screams -- the monster sliding past her, intent on Bob. The rough hide scrapes h tearing her clothes, leaving raw bleeding lacerations on torso.
I'm bleeding!
Larry and Patrick help her towards the rocks.
Help!
He's clinging to a piece of broken boat; the Shark lunges him.
grinding, smoking, hauling something out of the water --  heavy, slimy, dripping metal cable, the main powerline fr the mainland!
paddling the raft towards Sean with desperate strokes,  heedless of the danger around him.
Hang on! Just hang on!
He fights to see in the gathering gloom. Suddenly, a stra glare snaps on, then more illumination, in a series of  escalating clicks.

Silhouetted against the evening sky. Automatic timers are turning on navigation and worklights, illuminating the ba rocks and rusty steel with their glare -- throwing dark  shadows, putting the surrounding water into black limbo b their contract.
straining to see what's going on. Looking for his son.
Dad! Help! Daddy!
I'm coming!
He looks around desperately, sees Andy safe on the launch
Andy! Use the lights! The lights!

soaked, clinging to the rail of the launch, hearing Brody fumbling in the cabin, turning on worklights, the boat  throwing erratic shafts of powerful light from its many l and searchlights. Andy grabs one and sweeps the water wit it, trying to help.
Where are you? Chief!
His light pokes and sweeps through the gloom.

He hears the horrendous sounds of wood and metal breaking as the raft pounds to pieces on the rocks. He is blinded the sweeping searchlight, the confusion of terror-stricke teen-agers screaming. It's the middle of The Inferno.
Sean, standing up, reaching out to him, the Shark hitting his fragile perch, Sean tumbling backwards, towards what  seems to be certain death.
Sean!
as he hurls his paddle at the Shark, anything to get even to distract it.
You bastard!
He looks around him wildly, searching for a weapon, findi a steel boathook. He screams at the unfeeling Shark...
Come here, you son-of-a-bitch!
The huge gray hulk obligingly turns towards this new  irritation. Brody bangs on the raft, yelling, creating a  commotion.
lunges at the raft, Brody sliding desperately away, smash at the snout with his steel, the tail fin bashing him as passes...

head_text.subj: THE STERN OF THE POLICE BOAT

text: Brody is drifting close to the cable, drawn heavy and wet cut of the water. He reaches up to it.
dangling his feet in the water, holding onto the cable, s it, inspired with a lunatic idea...
Over here! You bastard! Over here
turns, bleeding from a superficial cut on its snout, its  scar glistening wet and terrible. It heads for Brody.
Possessed, yelling at the top of his lungs.
Come and get me! Come and get me!

Attacking. Missing Brody, who hauls himself up out of the way in life-or-death spasm. The great jaws close, fasteni onto the thick cable. Shaking it. The cable resists for a moment, then splits, layers or insulation and armor crack open, the jaws clamp harder -- 20,000 tons of pressure -- then the live copper core is reached. Zap!
dying. Leaping and convulsing as hundreds of thousands of volts surge through its body, grounded in the salt sea. H white fire shimmers like a halo, the fish smokes and stin sputters, and dies.

watching, cowering on the rubber raft to which he fell wh the shark hit the cable. It's strangely silent. The light on Cable Junction flicker and die as circuit breakers shu down the mains, protecting the line. Only the boat's  worklights provide light now.
Sean?
No answer. Water lapping at the rocks, some Kids sobbing  quietly. Brody listlessly paddles towards the wreckage of the raft, expecting the worst...
Timmy's Doughdish, where we last saw Sean. There's a  scrabbling from inside, and Sean appears, soaked, from un the seat where he'd fallen.
Dad?
Brody moves toward him, holds out his arms, taking Sean o his raft. They paddle back towards the rocks.
with the Kids clinging like drowned rats to the rocks; th wet, scared, exhausted, but safe. Sean hugs his daddy as  they step onto land.
They made me go with them.
Sure they did...
He kisses the damp forehead.
A crowd of worried parents and adults, Ellen and Hendrick in the forefront, are staring towards the harbor mouth. I dawn and the sun is rising. They see something, a cheer g up.
A big Coast Guard cutter is steaming into the harbor, a l group of survivors on the foredeck.
